item.title: The 2015 Budget of Singapore provides support for businesses
item.description:
Source: Ministry of Finance, Singapore. Infrastructure investments were also announced as part of Budget 2015. Singapore’s Budget 2015, presented by Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam, included several business initiatives. These encompassed increased training assistance, a gradual reduction in business restructuring aid, a freeze on foreign worker levies (excluding manufacturing and construction), and measures to encourage innovation and expansion. Training and development Shanmugaratnam emphasized the government’s commitment to continuous investment in Singaporeans’ skills development...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-2015-budget-of-singapore-provides-support-for-businesses/

item.title: Aptugo develops customized web software without requiring any training
item.description:
Aptugo, a software tool designed to help individuals without coding experience build websites, is currently in beta testing. Developed by the company Aptugo, the software is expected to launch in 2015. “Aptugo has the potential to bridge the gap between large and small businesses. Users don’t need any programming knowledge to use it,” stated Gaston Gorosterrazu, Head of Aptugo. “However, those with coding experience can further enhance what Aptugo can do, as it is designed to empower users and expand their capabilities...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/aptugo-develops-customized-web-software-without-requiring-any-training/

item.title: ASEAN releases strategic plan for the development of small and medium enterprises
item.description:
Source: ASEAN Secretariat. The ASEAN Strategic Action Plan for SME Development (SAPSMED) 2016-2025 acknowledges the significant role of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in ASEAN’s economic growth, job creation, and women’s empowerment. The plan seeks to enhance MSME participation in an increasingly competitive market and support their expansion and progress. This plan outlines an implementation roadmap utilizing country representatives, leveraging available resources, including those from ASEAN Dialogue Partners, and incorporating regular monitoring and evaluation...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/asean-releases-strategic-plan-for-the-development-of-small-and-medium-enterprises/

item.title: SCALA, the Singapore Workforce Development Agency, is offering a logistics reskilling program
item.description:
The Singapore Workforce Development Agency (WDA) and Supply Chain and Logistics Academy (SCALA) joined forces to launch the Logistics Professional Conversion Programme (PCP). The initiative aims to help professionals, managers, executives, and technicians (PMETs) gain the necessary skills to enter the logistics industry. This program seeks to create opportunities for newcomers and seasoned professionals in logistics, allowing them to expand their skillsets and advance their careers. Over the next two years, the PCP will offer 150 positions for PMETs, specifically as Logistics Officers and Logistics Executives...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/scala-the-singapore-workforce-development-agency-is-offering-a-logistics-reskilling-program/

item.title: Eight multilateral development banks (MDBs) working together to speed up efforts to reduce transportation emissions
item.description:
Eight major development banks have come together to address the significant impact of transportation on climate change. These institutions acknowledge that the transportation sector, responsible for a considerable portion of global energy consumption and emissions, needs more action to minimize its environmental footprint and enhance its resilience to climate change. The African Development Bank, Asian Development Bank (ADB), CAF-Development Bank of Latin America, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, European Investment Bank, Inter-American Development Bank, Islamic Development Bank (ISDB), and the World Bank (WB) have pledged to expedite their efforts in several key areas...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/eight-multilateral-development-banks-mdbs-working-together-to-speed-up-efforts-to-reduce-transportation-emissions/

item.title: In 2016, Japan and Australia are expected to attract significant real estate investment
item.description:
Asian real estate trends in 2016 are predicted to mirror those of 2015, with substantial capital flowing into prime properties and investors seeking refuge in the region’s most established and stable markets, according to the Emerging Trends in Real Estate Asia Pacific 2016 report, a joint publication by the Urban Land Institute (ULI) and PwC. Japan and Australia remain top choices for real estate investment and development. Tokyo, Sydney, Melbourne, and Osaka secured four of the top five positions for promising markets in the Asia Pacific region, with Ho Chi Minh City rounding out the list in fifth place...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/in-2016-japan-and-australia-are-expected-to-attract-significant-real-estate-investment/
